threads.title: Short-term Business Ideas
threads.excerpt:
# Short-term Business Ideas

**Date:** 2025-07-11

---

**User:** Hi Fred, you've gotten to know me quite well and have a good understanding of my goals with Carlorbiz and Make the Most of Today. Can

threads.title: **1. MVP Scope for Low/No-Code App with Admin Panel (Google Sheets/Excel Backend)**

threads.title: 💡 Optional Additions You Can Mention Later
threads.excerpt:
> 7. Show how I can **add or edit content** in the Google Sheet and have it sync back to the app

---

### 💡 Optional Additions You Can Mention Later
- I'd like to add **subscriptions** or gated acces
breakthrough_moments:
This lets you:

- Offer **predefined, selectable Tags** in journal entry forms
- Keep Tags clean and consistent (vs lots of free-text duplicates like “grief”, “Grief”, “sadness”)
- Easily group or filter journal entries by topic later

---

## ✅ Suggested Structure for the Tags Table

| **TagID** | **TagLabel**        | **Description (optional)**       |
|-----------|---------------------|----------------------------------|
| 1         | gratitude           | Moments of appreciation          |
| 2         | grief               | Loss, letting go, endings        |
| 3         | joy                 | Lightness, laughter, uplift      |
| 4         | burnout             | Fatigue, overload, disconnection |
| 5         | connection          | Belonging, support, love         |
| 6         | boundaries          | Limits, saying no, energy guard  |
| 7         | identity            | Who you are, who you’re becoming |
| 8         | resilience          | Strength through struggle        |
| 9         | imposter syndrome   | Doubt, fraud feelings, pressure  |
| 10        | purpose             | Meaning, direction, alignment    |
| 11        | self-worth          | Value, deserving, enough-ness    |
| 12        | transformation      | Growth, change, breakthrough     |
| 13        | acceptance          | Grace, surrender, softening      |
| 14        | leadership          | Influence, authenticity, impact  |
| 15        | calm                | Rest, reset, slow living         |

You can tweak this list to reflect your voice or tone — some people prefer single words (`grief`), others use short phrases (`feeling unseen`, `hard decisions`)

learnings.summary:
Correction: Time + Cost Estimate for Launch**

### 🧱 **Phase Breakdown**
| Phase | Time Estimate | Cost Estimate
learnings.details:
Time + Cost Estimate for Launch** ### 🧱 **Phase Breakdown** | Phase | Time Estimate | Cost Estimate | Tasks | |-------|---------------|---------------|-------| | Planning & Branding | 1 week | $0–$250 (if DIY logo/fonts) | App flow, visual moodboard, brand kit | | Content Development | 2 weeks | $0 (your writing + voice) | Write 30 prompts, 5 resets, audio | | App Build (Glide) | 2–3 weeks | Free – $99/mo | Set up database, logic, layouts | | Beta Testing | 2 weeks | ~$200 (incentives) | Feedback loop, bug fixes | | Launch Prep (App Store) | 1 week | **$25 (Google Play, one-time)**
**$99/year (Apple)** | App Store assets, compliance, testing | | Marketing | Ongoing | $50–$300 | IG/LinkedIn/email setup, lead magnet, landing page | ### 💰 **Total Estimated Budget** | Category | Range | |----------|-------| | **DIY MVP Launch** | ~$375 – $1,000 | | **With Upgrades & Outsourcing** | $2,000 – $5,000 | --- Would you like me to: - Start building your Glide app structure and Sheets backend? - Draft a full 30-day prompt pack (with optional audio script)? - Design your visual brand board or sample screen mockup? Let’s pick one first step and get this underway — we’ll build a soulful, useful, and *uniquely Carla* product 🌿 **Tool:** Model set context updated

learnings.summary: Methodology: They prefer a low/no-code approach with backend control via Google Sheets or Excel, especially to ma
learnings.details:
They prefer a low/no-code approach with backend control via Google Sheets or Excel, especially to manage subscriptions. Let's delve into the development of your "Make the Most of Today" mobile app, focusing on a low/no-code approach that ensures backend control via Google Sheets or Excel. , via email or code)

---

## 🟡 **Suggested Strategy**
- Use **free Glide tier** to build and test with close users
- Collect feedback + refine content and flow
- Upgrade to **Starter plan ($25/month)** only when:
  - You need more rows
  - You want to allow more private users
  - You're ready for custom branding or monetisation

---

Would you like me to prepare a starter Google Sheet in the correct structure for Glide so you can link it directly and begin building in the free version? I can also walk you through how to set up user-specific journaling on the free plan
learnings.evidence: They prefer a low/no-code approach with backend control via Google Sheets or Excel, especially to manage subscriptions

learnings.summary:
Methodology: ---

Would you like me to regenerate the Prompts and Reset Phrases spreadsheets with the column rena
learnings.details:
---

Would you like me to regenerate the Prompts and Reset Phrases spreadsheets with the column renamed to `Script_Notes`, so it's clear it's placeholder/internal for now?

**User:** No it's ok, I'll follow your instructions and rename that column in both sheet now (and leave rows empty?)

**Assistant:** Perfect — yes, your approach is spot on:

### ✅ To Summarise:

- **Rename `AudioScript` to `Script_Notes`** in both the **Prompts** and **Reset Phrases** sheets
- **Leave the cells empty** where you haven’t drafted anything yet — totally fine!
- This column can stay hidden from the user-facing app view, but will be super helpful later when you're ready to:
  - Record voiceovers
  - Add audio player components
  - Batch-create audio assets without reinventing your tone each time

---

You're building this in a clean, scalable way, Carla — let me know when you're ready to set up screen flows in Glide or begin scripting a short onboarding voice clip. I will create a separate table for the Tags as a new Google Sheet?

**Assistant:** Yes, exactly! Creating a **separate Tags table** as a new sheet in your Glide-connected Google Sheet is the best approach
